examples: The best professional musicians start young.
The young actress received an award for her outstanding performance.
Those young people have some guts.
That young woman was close as an oyster!
The young man was a twenty-one-year-old college student.
words.defineEn: still in the earlier stages of life
words.defineVi: vẫn còn trong giai đoạn đầu của cuộc sống

examples: My father is quite old now
This thankless IT support job is really getting old.
This old house gives me the willies.
The old man gave up the ghost.
The old man considered his granddaughter thoughtfully.
words.defineEn: (of a person) in the later stages of life
words.defineVi: (của một người) trong giai đoạn sau của cuộc đời

examples: Stupid is as stupid does.
Stupid is as stupid does.
You're always pushing it and you take stupid risks!
No bashing your stupid head against a wall is ever gonna change that.
My wedding was supposed to be my special day, but my sister and her stupid boyfriend took the stage when he proposed to her at the wedding reception.
words.defineEn: not having common sense or the ability to understand or learn quickly
words.defineVi: không có ý thức chung hoặc khả năng hiểu hoặc học hỏi nhanh chóng

examples: I feel thirsty and need a sip of water.
As the rain poured, the thirsty plant absorbed water through its roots, nourishing its leaves and stems.
They were all thirsty so I gave them a drink.
Toto and I are thirsty.
'I'm thirsty.'
words.defineVi: muốn hoặc cần một thức uống

examples: The adventurer used the tail fat as a survival resource during their journey in the wilderness.
The fat is in the fire now, huh?
The stock market rally resulted in a fat return on investment for many investors.
The company's new product launch led to a fat increase in revenue.
She proudly served a fat hen-infused pesto at the neighborhood potluck.
words.defineEn: (of people or animals) weighing much more than what is thought to be healthy for their body
words.defineVi: (của người hoặc động vật) nặng hơn nhiều so với những gì được cho là lành mạnh cho cơ thể của họ

examples: The carpet has worn thin in places.
She includes thin slices of celery in her diet.
Her husband disappeared into thin air for years.
They built the cell phone industry out of thin air in the mid-1980s.
She layered thin slices of prosciutto between crusty bread, fresh mozzarella, and sun-dried tomatoes for a gourmet panini.
words.defineEn: (of people or animals) weighing less than what is thought to be healthy for their body
words.defineVi: (của người hoặc động vật) cân nặng thấp hơn những gì được cho là lành mạnh cho cơ thể của họ

examples: The tall building stands out among the other structures in the city.
The tall oak tree provided shade on a hot summer day.
The tall Texan ruffled some English feathers with his remarks.
After dinner she told me a tall tale about her pet.
To grow bigger/taller/older.
words.defineEn: (of a person or thing) having a height that is greater than what is thought to be the average height
words.defineVi: (của một người hoặc vật) có chiều cao lớn hơn chiều cao được cho là trung bình

examples: Two could play at that game, smart guy.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
Buying a house in this neighborhood is a smart move.
He gained a reputation as a smart number-cruncher who could turn data into policy.
She's not too smart, but at least her heart is in the right place.
words.defineEn: able to think and learn in a good and quick way
words.defineVi: có thể suy nghĩ và học hỏi một cách tốt và nhanh chóng

examples: The plans for the new development have raised angry protests from local residents.
His angry glance said it all.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
My grandmother got angry when I accidentally spilled juice on the carpet.
My boss was so angry that I really got the rough edge of his tongue.
words.defineEn: feeling very annoyed or upset because of something that we do not like
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất khó chịu hoặc khó chịu vì điều gì đó mà chúng tôi không thích

examples: For the first offence I was given a fine.
There's a fine line between humour and inappropriateness.
Our fine traditions give us a head start on the competition.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
If he wants to play a game of cat and mouse, fine, I'll play.
words.defineEn: not ill, injured, or in a bad state
words.defineVi: không bị bệnh, bị thương, hoặc trong tình trạng xấu

examples: Oh yeah, that was sad.
That's pretty sad if you ask me.
Sad, woe is us, to come to this plight!
She would cry at the drop of a hat when watching sad movies.
It would be humorous if it weren't so sad the way Sarah tiptoes around her wife.
I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
I'm hungry.
This dish will serve four hungry people.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
Eva is so hungry that she can eat a horse.
I’m getting a bit hungry.
words.defineEn: needing or wanting something to eat
words.defineVi: cần hoặc muốn một cái gì đó để ăn

examples: I'm excited about the next episode of my favorite TV show.
The children were excited to try the unusual-looking dragon fruit, an exotic accessory fruit.
The children were excited to learn about colors in art class.
We are excited to travel to our friend's wedding in another state.
She was excited to buy new clothes for the summer season.
words.defineEn: feeling very happy, interested, and energetic
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất hạnh phúc, thích thú và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: I'll be ready in a minute.
I'm ready to start the process of writing.
I'm ready to drop!
The cookie dough is ready to be rolled into small balls and baked.
He's always ready to help at the drop of a dime.
words.defineEn: mentally or physically prepared for a situation or activity
words.defineVi: chuẩn bị tinh thần hoặc thể chất cho một tình huống hoặc hoạt động
